question_text: Why might a 24-pin motherboard connector appear to be split into a 20-pin and a detachable 4-pin block?
answer_options: To allow use in older 20-pin boards
To reduce EMI noise in the main power rail
To provide surge protection to USB ports
correct_answer: To allow use in older 20-pin boards
explanation: Many PSUs feature 20+4 pin connectors so they can be compatible with both old 20-pin and modern 24-pin motherboards.
